results.title: Maintenance of office machines
results.creator_credit: De Frenes and United States. Navy
results.brief_description: Demonstrates methods for the care and maintenance of typewriters, transcribing machines, dictaphones, adding machines and calculators.

results.title: Maintenance and sharpening of power saw chains
results.brief_description: Unsatisfactory performance and service of power saw chains is usually due to inadequate maintenance. Shows three basic rules for maintenance: check chain tension; check oiling system and use only correct oil; regularly “touch up” chain cutting teeth with file without removing from saw.
results.title_for_label: Maintenance and sharpening of power saw chains
results.description: Unsatisfactory performance and service of power saw chains is usually due to inadequate maintenance. Shows three basic rules for maintenance: check chain tension; check oiling system and use only correct oil; regularly “touch up” chain cutting teeth with file without removing from saw.
description_for_label: Unsatisfactory performance and service of power saw chains is usually due to inadequate maintenance. Shows three basic rules for maintenance: check chain tension; check oiling system and use only correct oil; regularly “touch up” chain cutting teeth with file without removing from saw.

results.title: Maintaining workers interest
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Caravel Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Various workers are shown doing poor work because their work holds no interest for them. The point is made that the supervisor should be alert to detect and remedy these situations wherever possible.

results.title: Maintaining the catch
results.brief_description: Intended to show fishermen the significance of biological research on crayfish populations in Western Australian waters. Animation is used to explain why the industry should restrict their catch and improve their livelihood at the same time. Emphasises the need for cooperation between scientists and fishermen.

results.title: Maintaining quality standards
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Mode-Art Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Various scenes emphasise the nature of quality standards. The role of the supervisor in maintaining quality as well as quantity is made clear by incidents involving poor instruction, carelessness, and lack of pride in good workmanship.

results.title: Maintaining good working conditions
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Mode-Art Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Presents several cases where an improvement in working conditions resulted in increased production. The importance of the part which must be played by supervisors in maintaining good working conditions is stressed.

results.title: Maintaining classroom discipline
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teacher Education”.
Provides the fundamentals for the proper control of class conduct and attitude. Contrasting methods of handling a class are shown.

results.title: Mainstreaming in action (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Togg Films, Ellen Barnes and Grania Gurievitch
results.brief_description: Shows several elementary and secondary classrooms in public schools as teachers work with disabled students as part of regular classroom sessions. Discusses solutions to problems teachers may encounter, the practicality of mainstreaming, what it means, and how it affects teachers and students. Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Togg Films, Ellen Barnes and Grania Gurievitch

results.title: Mainly monkeys. Koalas and co
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Louise Jonas
results.brief_description: Contains two programmes filmed at Melbourne Zoo. 1.”Mainly monkeys” shows the social behaviour of groups of monkeys and other primates that live in trees. 2.”Koalas and Co.” observes some Australian animals adapted for life in trees, such as koalas, fruit bats, tree frogs and lizards. Both programmes are non-narrated, making use of natural sound.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob McCubbin, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Louise Jonas
results.description: Contains two programmes filmed at Melbourne Zoo. 1.”Mainly monkeys” shows the social behaviour of groups of monkeys and other primates that live in trees. 2.”Koalas and Co.” observes some Australian animals adapted for life in trees, such as koalas, fruit bats, tree frogs and lizards. Both programmes are non-narrated, making use of natural sound.

Both programmes are non-narrated, making use of natural sound.

results.title: Mainly monkeys
results.creator_credit: Louise Jonas, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Rob McCubbin
results.brief_description: Filmed in close detail at the Royal Melbourne Zoological Gardens, the Sir Colin Mackenzie Fauna Park, Healesville and the Royal Botanic Gardens, Melbourne, with minimal evidence of enclosures. Shows groups of monkeys and other primates living in trees, their feeding and grooming habits, their method of communication and care of the young. Adapted from “A Zoo in the trees”. Non-narrated using natural sound. Suitable for middle and upper pprimary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Jonas, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Rob McCubbin
